page.title: 14SANDPITS IN SEND
page.content: Send, as its name suggests, has been well known since the 19th century for its sand and associated industry. Sand and gravel pits are still being dug by Halls Aggregates Ltd. Local people are permitted to dig certain pits for themselves provided no mechanical means are used. Some of those pits no longer being worked have been flooded and are used for water activities. An Angling Club provides private fishing in disused gravel pits known as The Lakes, and the Sailing Club is sited on Papercourt Lake. These areas of water also attract a variety of birds including large flocks of visiting Canada geese. In some cases the pits have been filled with domestic rubbish and levelled, covered with topsoil and landscaped.These areas cannot be built on for a number of years, although some earlier sites are now built on.
